On the Wednesday edition of Breitbart News Daily, on SiriusXM Patriot Channel 125 from 6AM to 9AM Eastern, Breitbart Executive Chairman Stephen K. Bannon will discuss the issues animating the 2016 election as witnessed during the Wisconsin primary race that pitted the globalist trade and immigration policies of Speaker Paul Ryan against the populist/nationalist positions of his long shot challenger Paul Nehlen.

We’ll also hear from Rick DeLano, the producer of the controversial must-see documentary called “The Principle.” Watch the trailer below:

Live from London, Rome, and Jerusalem, Breitbart correspondents will provide updates on the latest international news.

We’ll hear from Breitbart’s Washington Political Editor Matt Boyle and Breitbart’s Julia Hahn, who have been reporting on the ground in Janesville, Wisconsin, will discuss the election results and the lessons learned from the Ryan vs. Nehlen race.

Curtis Ellis — the Trade Policy Advisor to Donald Trump and Executive Director of the American Jobs Alliance, an independent non-profit organization promoting pro-jobs and Buy American policies — will join us to discuss Trump’s trade plan.
Breitbart’s Lee Stranahan will report on the latest information in our investigation of the story of the horrific rape of a 5-year-old girl by three Muslim migrant boys in Twin Falls, Idaho.

SiriusXM Vice President for news and talk Dave Gorab called the show “the conservative news show of record.”

Follow Breitbart News on Twitter for live updates during the show.
Breitbart’s Tech Editor Milo Yiannopoulos will discuss his article on Speaker Paul Ryan and the alt-right.
Breitbart News Daily is the first live, conservative radio enterprise to air seven days a week.
Frank Gaffney of the Center for Security Policy will update us on national security issues.
Listeners may call into the show at: 866-957-2874.
